intro: Centaurium umbellatum subsp. majus, commonly known as the greater lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, clustered flowers with five narrow lobes. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color and bloom from June to August. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger flowers and more robust growth compared to other centaury species.
